body:
Dear all,
I'm actually trying to figure out if it's possible to add a shading control to a window in the Energy+ script by using some HoneyBee components. In particular I would like to add a setpoint, for example "OnIfHighSolarOnWindow" with a setpoint of 120 W/m2, as you can do in the IDF Editor of the Energy+ tool. See screenshots below. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/STKcnUst*ZQ0wgqLD32ckQBRVNXiQFs4KbUfFDwt2P8GR2v1kCuQOWcFPnjPTCfqfllM4CxJO5iF3cbi*3UausPj*Y0t-5ey/Capture.JPG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/STKcnUst*ZRDwIXY5KSyJP43WsuO6LGwnZIlYof-pMIR2KgFpislF4C4n4QLCxEYXExNlSQyRE*3QK68IThwUTZxGpCyxHFs/Capture2.JPG) I'm wondering if I necessarily have to dive into the wonderful world of the "additionalStrings" input in the HoneyBee_RunEnergySimulation panel or if there's an easier way since I'm not really confident with scripts.

Thanks a lot in advance,
Claudio
topic: Shading Control with a defined setpoint
